alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; Hughes; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Garvin, Seminole, southeastern Cleveland, northwestern Pontotoc, southwestern Pottawatomie, northwestern Hughes and southeastern McClain Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 630 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Wetumka to near Wanette to near Foster. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seminole, Pauls Valley, Holdenville, Wewoka, Stratford, Konawa, Wetumka, Maysville, Byng, Maud, Elmore City, Wayne, Paoli, Bowlegs, Asher, Wanette, Cromwell, Byars, Foster and St. Louis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 66 and 86. Interstate 40 between mile markers 207 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
